articles.author: Farah Elbahrawy, Reema Al Othman
articles.title: Saudi Arabia Puts City in Eastern Province Under Virus Lockdown
articles.description: Saudi Arabia suspended entry and exit from Al Qatif governorate in the oil-rich Eastern Province after 11 coronavirus cases in the kingdom originated there.

articles.author: Sumio Ito
articles.title: Japan to Offer Interest-Free Loans to Small Companies, Abe Says
articles.description: Japan’s government will offer financial assistance to small businesses as part of a second round of emergency measures against the coronavirus, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said.
articles.content:
Visitors take photographs on Ninen-zaka slope as the Hokanje temple stands in Kyoto.

articles.author: Alessandro Speciale, Ross Larsen
articles.title: Italy's Drastic Containment Rules Don't Seem to Have Changed Life Much
articles.description: Italy introduced far reaching measures to contain the coronavirus outbreak on Sunday, yet hours after the dramatic early morning announcement, it was far from clear how strictly they would be enforced.
articles.content:
A gondola is seen on the Grand Canal in Venice on March 8.
